description.p: Not much is known about this race of small, catlike humanoids. Supposedly they hail from the far north, but even that information has been vagued by obscurity.
Most faeli are born with an innate affinity for magic. Be it library-dwelling scholars or swird-swinging warriors, magic always intertwines their goals and everyday lives.
Your faeles character has certain characteristics in common with all other faeli.

Ability Score Increase.Your Intelligence score increases by 1, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.
Age.Faeli reach physical maturity around age 10 to 15, but can live to be over a thousand years old.
Alignment.Faeli typically care about their own place in the world most of all, tending towards neutral alignments.
Size.Faeli are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.
Speed.Your base walking speed is 25 feet.
Darkvision.Your catlike heritage and life in the dark north grants you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You cannot discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
On Your Feet.You have resistance to falling damage, and when you fall, you can choose to land on your feet.
Languages.You can speak, read, and write Common and Faelian. The Faelian language has mostly been lost to time, and is only practiced by a select few scholars and librarians.
Subrace.Two subraces of faeli exist, pureblood and feralborn. Choose one of these subraces.

description.p: Feralborn faeli were brought into the world with an uncommon faeles birth defect that prevents them from using or storing any sort of magic. They have more catlike features, including a thin layer or fur that covers their body. NOTE: This type of faeles is incapable of casting spells! Do not take any classes that are capable of casting spells!

Feline Agility.Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your tum in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the tum. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.
